H0.text: What is the name for the flexible, connective tissue found in the joints between bones. Cartilaginous

H1.text: What is the name for the flexible, connective tissue found in the joints between bones. Osteotic

H2.text: What is the name for the flexible, connective tissue found in the joints between bones. Synovial

H3.text: What is the name for the flexible, connective tissue found in the joints between bones. Chondric

A4.text: synovial joint – not directly joined – the bones have a synovial cavity and are united by the dense irregular connective tissue that forms the articular capsule

A5.text: cartilaginous joint – joined by cartilage. There are two types: primary cartilaginous joints composed of hyaline cartilage

A6.text: synovial tissue is sterile and composed of vascularized connective tissue that lacks a basement membrane

A7.text: The inner membrane of synovial joints is called the synovial membrane and secretes synovial fluid into the joints
